title: Afternoon Retreat
description: A reflection on the quiet moments shared between a child and their dog, illustrating the serenity of nature's simple pleasures.
headerDescription: Serene moments between a child and dog by the water.
stanza1:
Water softly speaks,
Boy and dog with hearts at ease,
Afternoon retreat.

title: Fission
description: A poetic exploration of nuclear fission and its metaphorical relationship to human connections.
headerDescription: Nuclear science as a metaphor for severed relationships.
stanza1:
Forever separated,
Our power was evaporated,
Split but equal.

title: Tachyon
description: Contemplating the theoretical particle that travels faster than light as a metaphor for human aspirations.
headerDescription: Faster-than-light particles as symbols of impossible human dreams.
stanza1:
Faster than light,
Moving forever, nothing in sight,
Blink darkness.

title: Knowledge
description: A commentary on the paradox of knowledge acquisition and the humility of true wisdom.
headerDescription: The paradox of wisdom: those who claim it most possess it least.
stanza1:
Fools think they have it,
The shrewd know they must have it,
Just go get a book.

title: Yersinia Pestis
stanza1:
Out of these boils,
Pours darkness I behold,
I awaken in a coffin.

title: The Bitter Loop
stanza1:
heart craves but mind fades,
ones prescription ones affliction,
all is well isn't it?

title: Through The Veil
stanza1:
see darkness within,
and I see darkness without,
the light still shines through.

title: Sorrows Hope
stanza1:
Shadow
appears behind
quickly, softly, calmly
oh but the light shall still pierce through
depart!

title: Sevenfold
stanza1:
I fall once then stand,
1 turns to 7 and they dance,
hope becomes hopeless.

title: Smitten
stanza1:
plain to the masses,
but you still rouse my passions,
cautious with my actions.

title: Antiphon for the Abyss
stanza1:
You the guard of the abyss
You who vitiates the sins of the sacrilegious
You the one who's laugh like quicksand
Coagulates those who stand testament against
God
You who is abaddon angel of sheol
The one who resides above the orthoptera
Keyholder of the bottomless pit
Approbation for the destroyer!
Reverence for abbadon!

title: Antiphon for the Elohim
stanza1:
You whose everlasting grace holds the elect in good favor,
You bolster the earth in your firm grasp and shelter,
The consecrated from the detestable.
You are the omnipresent One,
The One who resides in Araboth,
The eternal King of heaven,
The One who treads upon Mt. Sinai.
Praise ELOHIM!

title: Antiphon for the Omnific
stanza1:
You, the adamantine forgiver, the one whose
love never flees.
You, the intransigent judge of the delinquent
and prosecutor of the reprehensible.

You are EL-ELYON — the Highest,

The One whose throne rests in the 7th heaven,

The One whose ordinance is steadfast.

Praise to Attiq Youm!
Praise to the Ancient One!

title: Antiphon for the Seraphim
stanza1:
You are the complete ones,
Whose burning desire permeates in the presence of the Perfect One.
You, the al-mash'ama (companions of the flame),
The ones who extol the Lord unfalteringly,
The ones whose faith is pure and without fail.
Admiration for the Seraph.
Reverence to the Burning Ones.

title: Life
stanza1:
The Child who just received a nintendo
switch for her 8th birthday
stanza2:
The man who had to hitch a ride home only
to find his mother's death
stanza3:
The piquant taste of sugar straight from the
cane
stanza4: The same sugar that leaves 88 thousand slain
stanza5:
A mundane day of tedious tasks
Not knowing that somewhere else is a
person's last
stanza6:
The freedom of a deer with the world to
explore
stanza7: Its life stripped away by a lion's vigor
stanza8:
We all think we see the big picture
But the pieces are scattered in the sand
Only time will reveal what we understand

title: Truth
stanza1:
What is it that makes people so keen to
believe without sight?
stanza2:
In a world that bores so many stories, a
generation could
stanza4:
The most lilliputian part—
yet dare to inquire
about the truth behind Columbus and your—
stanza5:
a
Fraud—
one who detests history as he was taught,
because why think that his story is
stanza6:
any
More than just that—
a tale, a tall one,
who's
unremitting presence towers above the mind
stanza7:
of every
Child that enters this system—
learning about a
history they have not witnessed: before
they can comprehend the elements that make
it up.
stanza8:
Kids are subject to scrutiny for using the
same words as another as an account of
Plagiarism—
subject to placate the owner of
words that were never his.
stanza9:
Teachers meant to teach us—
instead
perpetuate lies in order to conciliate Mann, the
progenitor of a system designed to uniformly
create—
stanza11:
We are told to be independent, yet taught as a
monolithic unit designed
To work for the system—
an apparatus who will
give its life for the advancement of a world
stanza12:
Whose face it doesn't even know.
The ones who deviate, who deviate—
cast aside as lunatics.
stanza13:
In a world that offers no proof,
the loudest voices
often drown out the truth.

title: Laborius Night Sky
stanza1:
Under the cover of night
Shine solus beings dethroned,
If only you knew you weren't alone.
stanza2:
Your redemption lamented,
Tehom says attest to the harshness,
Confined to a precinct of darkness.
stanza3:
Sloane's machinate propaganda,
There ruthless starkness strikes home,
If only you knew you weren't alone.
stanza4:
Your concealment carried out,
You lie harmless but obnoxious,
Confined to a precinct of darkness.
stanza5:
Your pain forgotten,
Through time neglected,
If only you knew you weren't alone.
stanza6:
You are forever bound,
Your freedom compound,
Confined to a precinct of darkness.

title: Man from Rochelle
stanza1:
There once was a man from Rochelle
His daughter her name cornell
She fell in a well
And awoke with a swell
As for the well, Rochelle

title: Dream About Joe
stanza1:
I once had a dream about Joe
Who kept a creepy pet crow
I awoke in a fright
On the coldest of nights
and realized i was at his chateau.

title: Ode to a Debutante
stanza1:
Oh, Debutante your radiance gleems,
The inside flows out like a marvelous stream.
Thy Missive reaches me, even as my heart averts thou,
My words freeze up if only I could convert thine.
stanza2:
Your brusque illudes me,
Still your warmth includes me.
A sense of folly it gives me,
Until our next meet a tally I keep thee.
stanza3:
Your presence inspires me,
I shall acquire thee.
Thy morals are worn,
Like garments untorn.
stanza4:
Thou beauty is peerless,
To defend it I will be fearless.
To meet you I must fall,
To forgo ego lest I stall.

title: Silent Sky
stanza1:
Silent sky
Whispers in the breeze
Night falls slow.

title: Sesquipedalian Reverie
description: a challenge on who could create a poem using sesquipedalian words from the list.
stanza1:
Antidisestablishmentarian dreams,
Supercalifragilisticexpialidocious gleams.
Floccinaucinihilipilification's plight,
Honorificabilitudinitatibus alight.
stanza2:
Counterrevolutionaries weave their prose,
Pseudopseudohypoparathyroidism grows.
Incomprehensibilities linger near,
Hippopotomonstrosesquipedaliophobia      : a fear.
stanza3:
Disproportionableness clouds the air,
Uncharacteristically, words declare:
That even sesquipedalian minds,
Find joy in syllabic binds.

title: Man from Manhatten
stanza1:
He was back from Manhatten
His daughter spoke latin
He came up with a plan
But first to go tan
As for the plan first tan

title: Man in the Savannah
stanza1:
There once was a man in the Savannah
Who dreamt he fought a pihranna
He awoke with a shake
As he felt heartache
He realized that he couldn't manage

title: Whispered Laurels
stanza1:
crown of shrubs
ancestral voices whisper
leaves falling

title: Grandmas House
stanza1:
bedroom drywall linen slumber
dawn yawn anticipate aroma
stanza2:
Countertop canister cutting-board stovetop
oatmeal sausage seconds fill-up
stanza3:
Driveway weeds pavement rubber
hoop elbows back-board sphere
stanza4:
Backdoor soggy mildew shriek
lightning stairs drizzling fresh

title: Grieving Soul
stanza1:
Let this grieving soul lie.
It will eat dirt as a serpent.
With sins wide as the sky.
Its shame forever lies fervent.

title: Starry Night
stanza1:
where life and death meet
I hear a weary heart beat
a starry night

title: Whispers of the Pinewood
stanza1:
Autumn leaves falling
Needles that whisper in wind
staying through it all.

title: Calm & Still
stanza1:
I feel the rains fall,
Hiss, Hiss, ahhhhhh,
The light dims low,
The storm won't end.

title: Struggle
stanza1:
Wake up, eat, sleep, repeat.
Wake up, eat, sleep, repeat.
Wake up, eat, sleep, repeat.
stanza2:
Every day's a gray pebble on a gravel path,
My future subject to the devil's wrath.
stanza4:
If I had a dollar for every time I hoped,
Then I'd be broke.
stanza5:
Oh wait—broke. I am broke,
Almost like my wallet had a stroke.
stanza6:
But scream—scream at me some more,
As if I like standing by while my destiny gets choked,
While I stay cloaked.
stanza8:
Four-fourths of my life spent a slave—
If only I could rent freedom for a day,
I'd stay away.
stanza9:
Away from that ravenous wolf,
Away from that venomous snake,
While desire pursues me like fleeting fire.
stanza10:
Once, I carried a thorn in my side,
Now, I'm a battered vase inside.
stanza11:
Sometimes you must get shattered
To let the light abide.

title: The Golden Horizon
stanza1:
surface and sky meet
turning a golden cheek
warmth consumes me

title: Veil of Mist on the Moors
stanza1:
a valleys dips deep
moors whisper in quiet fog
barren yet beautiful

title: Winter's Quiet Reverie
stanza1:
Footprints fade in snow
past silently slips away
thought concealed in frost

title: The Silvered Brook
stanza1:
the silvered brook
moonlight dances upon
reflecting things within

title: In the Heart of the Forest Grove
stanza1:
leaves crumble under foot
wind sighs through the canopy
plundering pain

title: A Meadow at Dawn
stanza1:
expanse of flowers
with a morning dew scent
almost that hour

title: The Tranquil Estate Garden
stanza1:
hedgerows of emerald
polished pathways meander
soft trickling water

title: Eclipsed by the Mountain's Shadow
stanza1:
dwarfed by its presence
sadness gleams in silence
coerced into reverence

title: Beneath the Weeping Willow
stanza1:
a place where tears flow
beneath the weeping willow
alleviating pain

title: At the Edge of the Terrace
stanza1:
I saw a man
at the edge of the terrace
curtain falls

title: By the Marble Fountain
stanza1:
a dove
by the marble fountain
lies gracefully

title: Quiet call of the woods
stanza1:
whispers echo
in the woods calling me
to come home

title: Chickadee's Lullaby
stanza1:
a chickadee murmurs
drifting as a ripple through water
soft moss holds the dawn

title: This broken scale
stanza1:
How depressing
This broken scale
Can no longer balance

title: In the sea
stanza1:
In the sea
descending the depths
a orca, clicks.

title: The Ships are moving
stanza1:
The ships are moving
and the hold packed
with slaves

title: Among the Laurel Trees
stanza1:
a gentle breeze
among the laurel trees
open heavens

title: Along the Garden Pathway
stanza1:
along the garden pathway
blooms shades of lavender, red, yellow
notes of rosemary

title: Upon the Estate
stanza1:
Icicles shimmer
adorning estates winter edge
fireplace crackles within

title: I see cars
stanza1:
i see cars
they fly bye
i long for solace

title: Sorrow In His Eyes
stanza1:
the man
on the street
sorrow in his eyes

title: Under suns rays
stanza1:
a pair decays
under suns rays
bon appetite

title: The Water Boils
stanza1:
the water boils
the noodles tender
a fork flies

title: The Ship Sinks
stanza1:
the ship sinks
water like a warm knife
a iceberg

title: The Crowd Cheers
stanza1:
a man plays
the crowd cheers
saxophone

title: Her Tears
stanza1:
The old woman grins
her face as crumpled paper
I see the tears.

title: Winter Mist
stanza1:
winter mist
a car crashes
in the distance

title: Hit The Deck!
stanza1:
a vulture
flies over-head
hit the deck

title: A Bird Wails
stanza1:
a bird wails
its voice muffled
its cry unheard

title: The Music Fades
stanza1:
lights dim
the music fades
whispers remain

title: Frosted Window
stanza1:
i see frost
on the window
a man is dead

title: Stillwater
stanza1:
the sign
in the distance
splash stillwater

title: The Ambulance
stanza1:
a ambulance
its siren blaring
a spirit wailing

title: Rome Divided
stanza1:
twin emperors
a nation unanimous
now divided

title: The Fowl Gather
stanza1:
a pair of birds
joined in discourse
a pair joins

title: A Bird's Dissipate
stanza1:
birds
in the distance
dissipate

title: Carol
stanza1:
the crowd
raise their voices
silver bells

title: Awaiting the Bus
stanza1:
a man
in a leather jacket
awaits the bus

title: Silica Dust
stanza1:
i wheeze
my lungs tighten
silica dust

title: Car Honks
stanza1:
a man
in all black
car honks

title: The Scarf Falls
stanza1:
two humans
banter about life
scarf falls

title: The Writer Drifts Asleep
stanza1:
a writer
at the table
drifts asleep

title: With Child
stanza1:
a woman
with her child
looks tired

title: Crossing the Street
stanza1:
a woman
on the phone
crosses the street

title: Camera Flashes
stanza1:
a car
its engine quickens
camera flashes

title: Chernobyl
stanza1:
in the distance
a pile of uranium
the town poisoned

title: A Lament for the Hydrangea
stanza1:
Once lush, and vibrant
a inspiration for–
all within reach
to chasten the masses
stanza2:
Now forsaken, you lie
slain from the root
by the grave even the-
graceful lie destitute
stanza3:
a martyr by the flame
a soul forfeited by fame
as you cling to this
zero-sum game
stanza4:
your radiant petals
muted
a salient spirit
rooted

title: Subtract
stanza1:
subtraction
  of
    items
      is
        addition
          to
            self

title: Weight of Legacy
stanza1:
weight of legacy--
on his shoulders, ice in my coffee
the world turns slowly.

title: Hand on My Face
stanza1:
her hand on my face
a frigid caress in bitter cold
a gentle rest awaits

title: A Bustling City
stanza1:
a bustling city--
heavy breath in humid air
all i saw was her hair

title: Forsaken
stanza1:
I have forsaken my passion,
and my passion has forsaken me.
stanza2:
I grieve,
but my tears fail to fall.
stanza3:
I've given up,
yet my body continues to move.
stanza4:
This silent body
houses a screaming soul.
stanza5:
My skin is warm,
yet I cannot stop shivering.
stanza6:
My heart races,
but my hands remain still.
stanza7:
Surrounded by love—
that fails to surround me.

title: Shall I Compare Thee to a Winter's Night?
description: The challenge was to do the inverse of a famous poem, in which I chose Shakespheares Sonnet XVIII. This was inspired by a great deal many relationships I have witnessed with the humurous addition of dan humprey, and blaire waldorfs.
stanza1:
Shall I compare thee to a winter's night?
Thou art more prickly, sharper in thy sting.
A bitter breeze doth seize November light,
and winter's reign hath far too strong a cling.
stanza2:
A soul beguiled by snow in chilling clasp,
and at night heaven lends it's clearest view.
Enough that I'd now yield to heaven's grasp,
and yet even still ice be frozen through.
stanza3:
While splinters of scorn fall like winter hail.
My pride, it fades as winter tows its cost.
Those eyes of glass that froze me in her stare.
A harsh reminder, with a heart of frost.
stanza4:
Not flame nor time dare try to reach to thee
Sublime! A glance that froze the sun had she.

title: Ode to a Pillar
stanza1:
O mother-pillar of the dawn—
Whose body brings forth light.
Thou poureth without measure,
and yet seeketh no recompense.
stanza2:
You stand firm as the mountains,
hewn from rock and do not faulter.
Thou singest lullaby's midst war,
against a hidden hand.
stanza3:
I knew not how your hands ached
how life sought to devour thee.
I mistook your tiredness for stillness,
not knowing still waters carry the most weight.
stanza4:
O mother—whose foot does not faulter—
on the jagged stone.
to what can one measure, the love of a mother?
Mayest thou point to god and non other?

title: Elegy of the Saints
stanza1:
O patient ones, Ones of Old—
The light has fled from twain eyes.
Thou perfect ones, the bold—
Ye that set thy word on highs.
stanza2:
Let not part from part began veering,
or to byword be our fate resigned.
Blistering winds we weather blind, steering—
the dotted line where death hath signed.
stanza3:
Hallowed halls beneath cinders lie,
and a mote of light is hence removed.
Witness as Gaia’s face is set awry,
for by sword the spec is reproved.
stanza4:
The unclean damn the clean for it taints,
whereby I implore the patience of the saints.

title: Exaltatio Mortis or "The Banquet of the Dead"
stanza1:
Lo, death rises upon an altar!
acting as the eternal exalter—
amidst the virgin in the dust.
Where the jailed and the jailor and the small and the great—
all eat off a eternal plate.
stanza2:
Here lie palaces of old, gilded manors, and halls—
where the privileged few threw many balls.
Cities that scrape the sky, lights without suns shine—
where they dine upon swine, and wine.
stanza3:
There is food without the hunt;
Travel atop undead beasts that roar.
Communion without a breath—
that lends itself to intangible wars—
that are fought without scores.
stanza4:
Though they praise freedom, they create slaves.
they cast a shadow, and curse not the source.
O Death! where is your strength? O Virgin Daughter, where is your crown?
Your strength is the grave; and your crown ground to dust.
stanza5:
But Lo! I feel thunder in the air.
the heavens I sense a movement their.
The sky cracked like a sheet of glass—
and yielded not to the upper class.
Red rivers flow forth and The dams burst as if told.
stanza6:
out the west arises hell from a pit below
quickly coming to quench it’s eternal woe
